author: acid0003
content:
the biggest problem I have with POS is that currently there is a small number of pool operators that put an incredible amount of effort into running their nodes as efficiently and reliably as possible
The people that run pools are those that are good at running pools, and probably barely mine themselves for the most part.
With POS, we have people that want to invest and collect a percentage that all of a sudden need to run the nodes that keep the network running smoothly. These are 2 completely separate skillsets, and I think it will result in non-stop pain.

author: acid0003
content: Either we will have the hashpower/stakepower centralized among a few people that know what they are doing, or we will have non-stop madness. For example I predict that 90% of validator nodes are going to move into AWS US-East so they have good latency with each other and the coin will be even more centralized then before when you at least had to be geographically close to a miner to maintain it
